articles.title: Chrome will let you switch between personal and work accounts on iOS
articles.description: Google is introducing the option to easily switch between personal and work profiles in its Chrome browser on iOS, with data kept separate between the two. The new option is part of Google’s enterprise software package, and doesn’t allow non-enterprise users to switch freely between two Google accounts in the browser. Companies that adopt Chrome […]
articles.author: Dominic Preston
articles.content: Google is introducing the option to easily switch between personal and work profiles in its Chrome browser on iOS, with data kept separate between the two. The new option is part of Google’s enterprise software package, and doesn’t allow non-enterprise users to switch freely between two Google accounts in the browser. Companies that adopt Chrome […]

articles.title: Engines of AI primed to accelerate new breakthroughs, economic growth, and transform the UK into an AI maker
articles.description: The government's new Compute Roadmap will harness AI to deliver on the UK's national priorities under the Plan for Change.
articles.content: The government's new Compute Roadmap will harness AI to deliver on the UK's national priorities under the Plan for Change.

articles.title: Enabling customers to deliver production-ready AI agents at scale
articles.description: Today, I’m excited to share how we’re bringing this vision to life with new capabilities that address the fundamental aspects of building and deploying agents at scale. These innovations will help you move beyond experiments to production-ready agent systems that can be trusted with your most critical business processes.
articles.author: Swami Sivasubramanian
articles.content: Today, I’m excited to share how we’re bringing this vision to life with new capabilities that address the fundamental aspects of building and deploying agents at scale. These innovations will help you move beyond experiments to production-ready agent systems that can be trusted with your most critical business processes.

articles.title: Isambard-AI, the UK’s Most Powerful AI Supercomputer, Goes Live
articles.description: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.
articles.author: Brian Caulfield
articles.content: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.

articles.title: NIST Ion Clock Sets New Record for Most Accurate Clock in the World
articles.description: This new result contributes to the international effort to define the second with a much greater level of accuracy than before, enabling new scientific and technological advances.
articles.author: Sarah Henderson
articles.content: This new result contributes to the international effort to define the second with a much greater level of accuracy than before, enabling new scientific and technological advances.

articles.title: NIH study links particulate air pollution to increased mutations in lung cancers among nonsmokers
articles.description: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.
articles.content: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.

articles.title: Elastic Cloud Hosted — FedRAMP Moderate Authorized now supports C7gd instances
articles.description: We are excited to announce the support of C7gd instance types in the Elastic Cloud Hosted — FedRAMP Moderate Authorized offering, bringing meaningful price-performance benefits to US agencies, partners, and organizations.The new C7gd instances — powered by AWS Graviton3 (ARM) processors with local NVME-based SSDs — offer better performance and efficiency. C7gd instances provide up to 45% better real-time NVMe storage performance than comparable Graviton2-based instances. This makes C7gd an...

articles.title: What is Mistral AI? Everything to know about the OpenAI competitor
articles.description: Mistral AI, the French company behind AI assistant Le Chat and several foundational models, is officially regarded as one of France’s most promising tech startups and is arguably the only European company that could compete with OpenAI. But compared to its $6 billion valuation, its global market share is still relatively low. However, the recent […]

articles.title: Statistical and Algorithmic Foundations of Reinforcement Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14444v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As a paradigm for sequential decision making in unknown environments, reinforcement learning (RL) has received a flurry of attention in recent years. However, the explosion of model complexity in emerging applications and the presence of nonconvexity exacerbate the challenge of achieving efficient RL in sample-starved situations, where data collection is expensive, time-consuming, or even high-stakes (e.g., in clinical trials, autonomous systems,...
articles.author: Yuejie Chi, Yuxin Chen, Yuting Wei

articles.title: Glitches in Decision Tree Ensemble Models
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14492v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Many critical decision-making tasks are now delegated to machine-learned models, and it is imperative that their decisions are trustworthy and reliable, and their outputs are consistent across similar inputs. We identify a new source of unreliable behaviors-called glitches-which may significantly impair the reliability of AI models having steep decision boundaries. Roughly speaking, glitches are small neighborhoods in the input space where the...
articles.author: Satyankar Chandra, Ashutosh Gupta, Kaushik Mallik, Krishna Shankaranarayanan, Namrita Varshney

articles.title: LaCache: Ladder-Shaped KV Caching for Efficient Long-Context Modeling of Large Language Models
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14204v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have spurred interest in numerous applications requiring robust long-range capabilities, essential for processing extensive input contexts and continuously generating extended outputs. As sequence lengths increase, the number of Key-Value (KV) pairs in LLMs escalates, creating a significant efficiency bottleneck. In this paper, we propose a new KV cache optimization paradigm called LaCache, a...

articles.title: Developing an AI-Guided Assistant Device for the Deaf and Hearing Impaired
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14215v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study aims to develop a deep learning system for an accessibility device for the deaf or hearing impaired. The device will accurately localize and identify sound sources in real time. This study will fill an important gap in current research by leveraging machine learning techniques to target the underprivileged community. The system includes three main components. 1. JerryNet: A custom designed CNN architecture that determines the direction...

articles.title: Accelerated Bayesian Optimal Experimental Design via Conditional Density Estimation and Informative Data
articles.description: arXiv:2507.15235v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Design of Experiments (DOEs) is a fundamental scientific methodology that provides researchers with systematic principles and techniques to enhance the validity, reliability, and efficiency of experimental outcomes. In this study, we explore optimal experimental design within a Bayesian framework, utilizing Bayes' theorem to reformulate the utility expectation--originally expressed as a nested double integral--into an independent double...

In this study, we explore optimal experimental design within a Bayesian framework, utilizing Bayes' theorem to reformulate the utility expectation--originally expressed as a nested double integral--into an independent double...

articles.title: UniPhyNet: A Unified Network For Multimodal Physiological Raw Signal Classification
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14163v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We present UniPhyNet, a novel neural network architecture to classify cognitive load using multimodal physiological data -- specifically EEG, ECG and EDA signals -- without the explicit need for extracting hand-crafted features. UniPhyNet integrates multiscale parallel convolutional blocks and ResNet-type blocks enhanced with channel block attention module to focus on the informative features while a bidirectional gated recurrent unit is used to...
articles.author: Renxiang Qiu, Raghavendra Selvan

UniPhyNet integrates multiscale parallel convolutional blocks and ResNet-type blocks enhanced with channel block attention module to focus on the informative features while a bidirectional gated recurrent unit is used to...

articles.title: IPPRO: Importance-based Pruning with PRojective Offset for Magnitude-indifferent Structural Pruning
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14171v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: With the growth of demand on neural network compression methods, the structured pruning methods including importance-based approach are actively studied. The magnitude importance and many correlated modern importance criteria often limit the capacity of pruning decision, since the filters with larger magnitudes are not likely to be pruned if the smaller one didn't, even if it is redundant. In this paper, we propose a novel pruning strategy to...
articles.author: Jaeheun Jung, Jaehyuk Lee, Yeajin Lee, Donghun Lee
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14171v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: With the growth of demand on neural network compression methods, the structured pruning methods including importance-based approach are actively studied. The magnitude importance and many correlated modern importance criteria often limit the capacity of pruning decision, since the filters with larger magnitudes are not likely to be pruned if the smaller one didn't, even if it is redundant. articles.title: Semi-Supervised Federated Learning via Dual Contrastive Learning and Soft Labeling for Intelligent Fault Diagnosis
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14181v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Intelligent fault diagnosis (IFD) plays a crucial role in ensuring the safe operation of industrial machinery and improving production efficiency. However, traditional supervised deep learning methods require a large amount of training data and labels, which are often located in different clients. Additionally, the cost of data labeling is high, making labels difficult to acquire. Meanwhile, differences in data distribution among clients may also...
articles.author: Yajiao Dai, Jun Li, Zhen Mei, Yiyang Ni, Shi Jin, Zengxiang Li, Sheng Guo, Wei Xiang
